page.title: 03LITTLE HONEYBOROUGH
page.content:
{Little Honeyborough}is a small hamlet comprising two working farms, a church and a few bungalows and houses, some of which are modern and others - renovated old properties. The{hamlet}straddles a very winding lane which joins the old Milford Haven -Neyland-Pembroke road. It is a very quiet{rural backwater}and has only a very small population of about 30. The centre of the hamlet is dominated by a very low-lying marshy area where some derelict farm buildings can be found. From the marsh issues a small stream which meanders towards Leonardston alongside which is an old public footpath. In this area are a few modern dwellings.
by Lorraine Groves
